Author: sindresorhus#8187
Content: @zatJUM Yes, we haven't set up a public key for HyperDEX yet, so we're using our own. @lukechilds will do that soon. You can confirm my key with Keybase: https://keybase.io/sindresorhus

Author: sindresorhus#8187
Content: @Hermes That's weird. Seems the `getendpoint` call we do to marketmaker succeeds but does not always return an URL as we expected. @lukechilds Seems we need to add some handling here https://github.com/atomiclabs/hyperdex/blob/93beff8026ef113b86487d3b8d9470dfa399c06c/app/renderer/api.js#L49 Or find a way to reproduce it and open an issue on marketmaker.

Author: sindresorhus#8187
Content: @Hermes Just to confirm, you have not set a "Custom Marketmaker URL" in the Settings, right? Can you reproduce the issue or did you only get it once?

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: @siu - Chainmakers we have a designer on the books now to go through the backlog. Your logo is the first one to be done. Please keep in mind that we have taken over the repo and we are paying designers to actually standardize the icons, it is another overhead but we will get it done.

Author: jansako#3330
Content: I have a bob node that has been up for a bit (~24 hours), there are active orders on it.  How do I make that bob to show up in HyperDEX? One cannot make a trade if custoemrs can't find him... I understand it is a matter of connections and who can see who. So how do I make myself seen? (If this is something that can be done, I can see a 'premium bob' service offering in the future...)

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Special bobs for everyone @jansako

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: We dont do anything special, so if it is not showing up in hyper, it probably is not showing up on barterDEX. Maybe speak to @siu - Chainmakers or @cipi they are masters in the craft

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Check your marketmakers mem use, and try restarting it. Sometimes orderbooks just stop working, and other times orderooks show but trades dont respond. I also advise using the release atrem posted yesterday instead of the marketmaker in jl's SuperNET repo.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: seemed to help the bob I am looking after.

Author: jansako#3330
Content: Taking this to #dev-marketmaker . thx!

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: @jansako in HyperDEX we strip out orders with 0 UTXOs from the order book

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: but it's unlikely that's the issue if your Bob is funded

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: you can manually inspect the requests in the network tab of dev tools to view the raw order book response

Author: jansako#3330
Content: It was not showing in HyperDEX or Dexstats orderbooks, so not your issue. Restarted MM and the orders do. I just need to keep an eye out for when they drop off & restart the bob again...

Author: jansako#3330
Content: thanks @lukechilds

Author: jorian#4555
Content: that can actually be done: when you do the withdraw script, you can define the `txfee`. if you make that max button subtract the txfee from it, the withdraw works. standard txfee is 10,000, but i've used lower ones in my withdraw script perfectly fine

Author: jorian#4555
Content: and since you work with SPV only, no weird issues with native can rise, like stuck cache or sth.

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: @sindresorhus re specifying a txfee, that works fine for alts with hardcoded tx values but is totally hit and miss with currencies like BTC/LTC/ETH with agressive fee markets

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: there is no single fee size that will guarantee a fast transaction

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: and you need to know the size of the transaction to calculate a good fee size

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: which depends entirely on the user's UTXO set
